newsitem.title: UK: Eurobonds settle down on European holidays.
newsitem.headline: Eurobonds settle down on European holidays.

text.p: The primary market ground to a halt on Thursday, with many European countries out of action due to Ascension day holidays.
No new issues were launched on Thursday, and activity was likely to remain subdued until next week, dealers said.
Imperial Chemical Industries said it was watching international bond markets with a view to refinancing part of a $8.5 billion loan taken out to buy Unilever's specialty chemicals division.
"We see it (loan) very much as a bridging facility," ICI finance director Alan Spall told Reuters. "We will certainly look to the long-term debt markets. Work is being put in place."
ICI is a rare Euromarket borrower, with just a few deals outstanding. They are a brace of 100 million stg bonds due 2003 and 2005, the last of which was launched in 1987.
ICI also has a $250 million deal due 2001 in the U.S. market.
Standard & Poor's Corp cut ICI's long-term credit rating to A- from A+ after news of the acquisition. Moody's Investor Service cut ICI to A3 from A2.
